text: So we saw that me, te, nos can mean me or to me, you or to you, us or to us, or even in some other circumstances for me or for us, for you.

text: Me, te, nos can also mean myself, yourself and ourselves.

text: But the ones beginning with L, so lo, la, los, las, they do change to get these different meanings.

text: So when we say to him, or to her, or to you, formal, or to them, we go from lo and la, and los and las, to le and les.

text: So lo and la becomes le, and los and las become les.

text: For example, lo doy means I give it.
